name: roo-nb
description: Notebook operation tools for Language Models

roo-nb.maxOutputSize.description: Maximum size (in characters) for cell output truncation

roo-nb.timeoutSeconds.description: Maximum seconds to wait for cell execution

languageModelTools.name: get_notebook_info
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Get comprehensive information about the active notebook, including URI, kernel, and cell statistics.

languageModelTools.name: get_notebook_cells
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Get information about all cells in the active notebook. Includes cell indexes, types, content, and outputs.

languageModelTools.name: insert_notebook_cells
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Insert multiple cells at a specified position in the active notebook. By default, new code cells are executed unless noexec is true.

cells.description: Array of cell definitions to insert. Each cell must specify content and cell_type.

content.description: The content of the cell to insert

cell_type.description: The type of cell to insert - either 'code' for executable cells or 'markdown' for text cells

language_id.description: Optional language ID for code cells (e.g., 'python', 'javascript'). If not provided, will try to infer from existing code cells or default to 'python'

insert_position.description: Optional position to insert cells. Defaults to the end of the notebook. Must be between 0 and the current cell count

noexec.description: If true, skips execution of inserted code cells. By default (false), code cells are executed after insertion

languageModelTools.name: replace_notebook_cells
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Replace a range of cells in the notebook with new cells. Uses half-open range [start_index, stop_index) - meaning stop_index is exclusive. Executed automatically unless noexec is true.

start_index.description: The starting index (inclusive) of the range of cells to replace

stop_index.description: The stopping index (exclusive) of the range of cells to replace. Must be greater than start_index. For example, to replace a single cell at index i, use start_index=i and stop_index=i+1

languageModelTools.name: modify_notebook_cell_content
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Modify the content of an existing cell. By default, modified code cells are executed unless noexec is true.

cell_index.description: The index of the cell to modify. Must be between 0 and the current cell count minus 1

content.description: The new content for the cell. Will maintain the cell's existing type and language

noexec.description: If true, skips execution of the modified cell if it's a code cell. By default (false), code cells are executed after modification

languageModelTools.name: execute_notebook_cells
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Execute a range of cells in the active notebook. Uses half-open range [start_index, stop_index) - meaning stop_index is exclusive.

start_index.description: The starting index (inclusive) of the range of cells to execute

stop_index.description: The stopping index (exclusive) of the range of cells to execute. Must be greater than start_index. For example, to execute a single cell at index i, use start_index=i and stop_index=i+1

languageModelTools.name: delete_notebook_cells
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Delete a range of cells from the notebook. Uses half-open range [start_index, stop_index) - meaning stop_index is exclusive.

start_index.description: The starting index (inclusive) of the range of cells to delete

stop_index.description: The stopping index (exclusive) of the range of cells to delete. Must be greater than start_index. For example, to delete a single cell at index i, use start_index=i and stop_index=i+1

languageModelTools.name: save_notebook
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Save the active notebook to disk.

languageModelTools.name: open_notebook
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Open a specified .ipynb file in the workspace and make it the active notebook editor.

path.description: Path to the .ipynb notebook file to open, relative to workspace root. The file must exist and be a valid Jupyter notebook

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
